body:
<!-- **Are you in the right place?**
1. For issues or feature requests, please create an issue in this repository.
2. For general technical and non-technical questions, we are happy to help you on our [Rook.io Slack](https://slack.rook.io/).
3. Did you already search the existing open issues for anything similar? -->

**Is this a bug report or feature request?**
* Bug Report

**Deviation from expected behavior:**
- The controller wasn't working because we missed to apply CRD(`CephRBDMirror`).
  - `status.phase` in `CephObjectStore` was not set.
  - Even though I prepared `ObjectBucketClaim`, `ConfigMap` was not created and S3 compatibility function was not available.
  - operator had output following error message, but it had not finished abnormally.

```
2020-05-07 06:56:54.141727 E | operator: unable to run the controller-runtime manager. no matches for kind "CephRBDMirror" i
n version "ceph.rook.io/v1"
```

- However, the result of `kubectl get cephclusters.ceph.rook.io` was HEALTH_OK.

**Expected behavior:**
I think it is better to terminate the Operator abnormally in the style Kubernetes if it encounters a serious error that can't provide service.

**How to reproduce it (minimal and precise):**
<!-- Please let us know any circumstances for reproduction of your bug. -->

- Prepare a manifest for building Rook/Ceph environment, remove only CRD of CephRBDMirror and apply it.

**File(s) to submit**:

* Cluster CR (custom resource), typically called `cluster.yaml`, if necessary
* Operator's logs, if necessary
  - As noted above.
* Crashing pod(s) logs, if necessary
  - Pod was not crashed.

**Environment**:
* OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): CoreOS 2345.3.0
* Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): 4.19.106-coreos
* Cloud provider or hardware configuration: x86_64 Intel(R) Xeon(R) Gold 5120 CPU @ 2.20GHz
* Rook version (use `rook version` inside of a Rook Pod): 1.3.2 later https://github.com/rook/rook/commit/382c6c3610caa2218f7ccbc51777bc5f15c667e3
* Storage backend version (e.g. for ceph do `ceph -v`): 15.2.1
* Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): 1.17.4
* Kubernetes cluster type (e.g. Tectonic, GKE, OpenShift): [CKE](https://github.com/cybozu-go/cke)
* Storage backend status (e.g. for Ceph use `ceph health` in the [Rook Ceph toolbox](https://rook.io/docs/rook/master/ceph-toolbox.html)):
title: ceph: The operator continues to run in spite of errors when launching the controller.
